ROUTES_TITLE: Routes in the Network of Castles and Palaces of Spain
ROUTES_DESCRIPTION_TEXT: On Spain Heritage you can find a series of routes that run through the network of castles and palaces in Spain. The routes are framed within a singular theme or style, making it easier to take advantage of and plan your tour of the most outstanding buildings in Spain. Travel the routes in full or plan each route to suit you. Simply Enjoy!

SERVICES_CONTACT_DETAILS: Contact us for more details, prices, availability and dates. We are happy to help you
castillosDescriptionText: Spain has cataloged more than 10,000 castles from all stages of its history, but only a small number of them have survived to this day in a reasonable state of conservation. Castle is a word that comes from the Latin castellun and refers to the place of strong construction , surrounded by walls, bastions, foci and other fortifications. Its origin dates back to the Roman forts and its construction evolved over more than 1,000 years throughout the Middle Ages and the beginning of the Renaissance, from the first watchtowers to the great stately castles of the 15th and early 16th centuries. In the RED NACIONAL DE PATRIMONIO HISTÓRICO and SPAIN HERITAGE NETWORK, we have selected the most emblematic castles in Spain that are in the best state of conservation, which can be accessed in the form of a cultural visit, housing, restaurant or the possibility of rent to celebrate some kind of event. Select the most attractive proposal through our search engine and enjoy our castles. Each castle that is a member of our network has a mini-website with all the information about its history, its characters and its tourist offer. We invite you to learn about the rich history of Spain, the landscapes, towns, gastronomy, manners and culture through our network of castles that will take you from the best known cities to the most remote villages of our geography. Through the Spain Heritage Network you will be able to discover impressive castles, many of which are still little known to the general public. We invite you to learn about the history of Spain through its castles.
palaciosDescriptionText: Just as Spain has a large number of cataloged castles, there are also a large number of palaces scattered throughout the Spanish geography that contribute in a notable way to the enrichment of our historical heritage. At SPAIN HERITAGE NETWORK we want to offer you the possibility of visiting the most important from a historical, architectural and artistic point of view. When the use of castles declined throughout the 16th century after the unification of the peninsular kingdoms, the nobles moved to more comfortable and luxurious homes throughout the towns and cities of Spain, building large stately palaces. Many of these palaces are still inhabited to this day and their owners have opened them to the public to reveal the history of such unique buildings and their most outstanding characters, as well as some important art collections accumulated over the centuries. Other palaces have passed into the hands of both public and private organizations in order to preserve their rich historical legacy and make it known by allowing it to be visited by the public. In the RED NACIONAL DE PATRIMONIO HISTÓRICO and SPAIN HERITAGE NETWORK we have selected the most emblematic palaces in Spain and that are in the best state of conservation, which can be accessed in the form of a cultural visit, accommodation, restaurant or the possibility of rent to celebrate some kind of event. Select the most attractive proposal through our search engine and enjoy our palaces. We invite you to learn about the rich history of Spain, landscapes, towns, gastronomy,manners and culture through our network of castles and palaces that will take you from the best-known cities to the most remote villages of our geography. Through the Spain Heritage Network you will be able to discover impressive Palaces, many of which are still little known to the general public. We invite you to discover the history of Spain through its Palaces.
palaciosRealesDescriptionText: The royal palaces are the houses of the members of the Spanish royal family or of the royal families of the kingdoms that lived together in the Iberian Peninsula before the unification of Spain completed at the beginning of the 16th century with the incorporation of Navarra to the crown of Castile. . Royal residences are considered to be the places where the King or Queen in power (who represents the Head of State), their spouse and their direct descendants, their children, live, work or maintain as summer houses, for recreation or for special purposes. , princes and princesses. It can be private residences, where members of the royal family live; of official residences, where they have their offices and/or serve for receptions or official visits; summer residences, vacation homes or for special uses; or of historical residences, which were inhabited by members of the royal family in the past, but no longer. Generally, these are palaces and mansions located in the capital of the country and in other cities, which the Royal House has obtained or had built throughout its history. These palaces, generally large, have many halls, private rooms, ballrooms, banquet halls, music halls, galleries, and are arranged in a central body and one or two lateral wings. They also have large and beautiful gardens, or even a hunting forest. In Spain, most royal residences are open to the public (the exception is the private residence); either all year round or when the monarch is not present. They have interesting museums related to the history of the Royal House or the monarchy in general. In addition, you can visit the gardens, some rooms or halls and, where appropriate, the graves of previous monarchs. In Spain, the royal residences are framed in the Royal Sites and are managed by National Heritage, which is a body dependent on the State. Also included in our selection are other royal palaces or palace castles that were so throughout history and that do not depend on National Heritage. We invite you to get to know the rich history of Spain, the landscapes, cities and towns, gastronomy,manners and culture through our network of castles and palaces that will take you from the best-known cities to the most remote villages of our geography. Through the Spain Heritage Network you will be able to discover impressive Royal Palaces, many of which are still little known to the general public. We invite you to discover the history of Spain through its Royal Palaces.
recintosAmuralladosDescriptionText: Spain has cataloged more than 10,000 castles from all stages of its history and a large number of walled enclosures and fortifications. In the RED NACIONAL DE PATRIMONIO HISTÓRICO and SPAIN HERITAGE NETWORK we have selected the most emblematic fortifications and walled enclosures in Spain and that are in the best state of conservation for your enjoyment. With this selection we intend to bring together the fortifications and walled enclosures of greatest historical importance, and which includes walled cities and towns whose defenses can be accessed and visited. Some of these walled enclosures are castles with great defenses but whose interior lacks additional constructions, although its walls alone deserve to be visited. Select the most attractive proposal through our search engine and enjoy our historical heritage. We invite you to get to know the rich history of Spain, the landscapes, cities and towns, gastronomy, manners and culture through our network of castles and palaces that will take you from the best-known cities to the most remote villages of our geography. Through the Spain Heritage Network you can discover impressive walled enclosures, many of which are still little known to the general public. We invite you to discover the history of Spain through its Walled Enclosures.
rutasRecomendadasDescriptionText: On Spain Heritage you can find a series of routes that run through the network of castles and palaces in Spain. The routes are framed within a singular theme or style, making it easier to take advantage of and plan your tour of the most outstanding buildings in Spain. Travel the routes in full or plan each route to suit you. Just enjoy!
